metadata.name: Container Registries Cache
metadata.description: Cache for Azure Container Registry (Preview) feature allows users to cache container images in a private container registry. Cache for ACR, is a preview feature available in Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers ([ref](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/tutorial-registry-cache)).
Required. The name of the parent registry. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the cache rule. Will be derived from the source repository name if not defined.
Required. Source repository pulled from upstream.
Optional. Target repository specified in docker pull command. E.g.: docker pull myregistry.azurecr.io/{targetRepository}:{tag}.
Required. The resource ID of the credential store which is associated with the cache rule.
The Name of the Cache Rule.
The name of the Cache Rule.
The resource ID of the Cache Rule.
